titleStmt.title:
ELEGY
ON
The Much-Lamented Death of John Harding Printer, who
departed this Transitory Life, this present Monday, being
the 19th of this Instant April 1725.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

div.lg:
WHEN Heav'n corrects, shall Man Complain,
Or in Sad Murmurs Sigh in vain,
Shall feeble Mortals low Estate,
E'er Question just unerring Fate,
Or Heaven's Decree, Injustice call,
Or Heaven's Decree, Injustice call,Or mourn poor Jack's untimely Fall;
Shall Men such Impious Thoughts engage,
And not provoke Heav'ns sharpest Rage?
Yet sure the Muse in mournful Lays
Yet sure the Muse in mournful LaysMay sighing murmur Harding's Praise;
Shall lesser Deaths her Pinnions try,
Shall lesser Deaths her Pinnions try,And Harding unlamented Die,
And shall one Pass, so Good and Great,
Unheeded like a Vulgar Fate,
Unheeded like a Vulgar Fate,Friendship it self the Muse inspires,
And with a double Ardour fires,
And what suh just Commands can break,
And what suh just Commands can break,When M. B. pleads for Harding's Sake,
s Sake,This Charms the Muse as this she Flies,
Again her shining Pinions rise
Again her Voice in lofty Strains,
Remurm'ring Eccho's through the Plains;
This Theme again inspires her Praise,
Again demands her mournful Lays:
Harding again the Muse has shewn,
Not good to all, excell'd by some.
Till Mounting up with Vig'rours Flight;
She Points a Shining stream of Ligiht,
Which brightly Glitt'ring from afar,
Again contracts, and shines a Star;
Another Light now Decks the Skyes,
Another Light now Decks the Skyes,And in a Star Brave Harding Dies.
Epitaph.__HERE Lies an Honest Man inter'd,
By Merit and by Chance prefer'd.
No Friend to Woods, as wise as brave,
Tho' now he's Level with the Grave,
The Drapier's Printer was he stil'd
While stout Snarlerus he beguil'd.
